(21)

Then we have that

ğ”¼pâ¢(ğm)â¢[ğ”¼qâ¢[logâ¡pâ¢(ğm|Î²,Î©)]]subscriptğ”¼ğ‘subscriptğğ‘šdelimited-[]subscriptğ”¼ğ‘delimited-[]ğ‘conditionalsubscriptğğ‘šğ›½Î©\displaystyle{\mathbb{E}}_{p({\bf e}_{m})}[{\mathbb{E}}_{q}[\log p({\bf e}_{m}% |\beta,\Omega)]]blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p ( bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ roman_log italic_p ( bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_Î² , roman_Î© ) ] ] â‰¤ğ”¼pâ¢(ğm)â¢[ğ”¼qâ¢[logâ¡pâ¢(ğm|Î²)]]absentsubscriptğ”¼ğ‘subscriptğğ‘šdelimited-[]subscriptğ”¼ğ‘delimited-[]ğ‘conditionalsubscriptğğ‘šğ›½\displaystyle\leq{\mathbb{E}}_{p({\bf e}_{m})}[{\mathbb{E}}_{q}[\log p({\bf e}% _{m}|\beta)]]â‰¤ blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p ( bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ roman_log italic_p ( bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_Î² ) ] ]
=ğ”¼pâ¢(ğm)â¢[ğ”¼qâ¢[logâ¡qâ¢(ğm|Î²)pâ¢(ğm)â¢pâ¢(ğm)â¢pâ¢(ğm|Î²)qâ¢(ğm|Î²)]]absentsubscriptğ”¼ğ‘subscriptğğ‘šdelimited-[]subscriptğ”¼ğ‘delimited-[]ğ‘conditionalsubscriptğğ‘šğ›½ğ‘subscriptğğ‘šğ‘subscriptğğ‘šğ‘conditionalsubscriptğğ‘šğ›½ğ‘conditionalsubscriptğğ‘šğ›½\displaystyle={\mathbb{E}}_{p({\bf e}_{m})}[{\mathbb{E}}_{q}[\log\tfrac{q({\bf e% }_{m}|\beta)}{p({\bf e}_{m})}\tfrac{p({\bf e}_{m})p({\bf e}_{m}|\beta)}{q({\bf e% }_{m}|\beta)}]]= blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p ( bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ roman_log divide start_ARG italic_q ( bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_Î² ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_p ( bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG divide start_ARG italic_p ( bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) italic_p ( bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_Î² ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_q ( bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_Î² ) end_ARG ] ]
=ğ”¼pâ¢(ğm)â¢[ğ”¼qâ¢[logâ¡qâ¢(ğm|Î²)pâ¢(ğm)]]+ğ”¼pâ¢(ğm)â¢[ğ”¼qâ¢[logâ¡pâ¢(ğm)]]+ğ”¼pâ¢(ğm)â¢[ğ”¼qâ¢[logâ¡pâ¢(ğm|Î²)qâ¢(ğm|Î²)]]absentsubscriptğ”¼ğ‘subscriptğğ‘šdelimited-[]subscriptğ”¼ğ‘delimited-[]ğ‘conditionalsubscriptğğ‘šğ›½ğ‘subscriptğğ‘šsubscriptğ”¼ğ‘subscriptğğ‘šdelimited-[]subscriptğ”¼ğ‘delimited-[]ğ‘subscriptğğ‘šsubscriptğ”¼ğ‘subscriptğğ‘šdelimited-[]subscriptğ”¼ğ‘delimited-[]ğ‘conditionalsubscriptğğ‘šğ›½ğ‘conditionalsubscriptğğ‘šğ›½\displaystyle={\mathbb{E}}_{p({\bf e}_{m})}[{\mathbb{E}}_{q}[\log\tfrac{q({\bf e% }_{m}|\beta)}{p({\bf e}_{m})}]]+{\mathbb{E}}_{p({\bf e}_{m})}[{\mathbb{E}}_{q}% [\log p({\bf e}_{m})]]+{\mathbb{E}}_{p({\bf e}_{m})}[{\mathbb{E}}_{q}[\log% \tfrac{p({\bf e}_{m}|\beta)}{q({\bf e}_{m}|\beta)}]]= blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p ( bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ roman_log divide start_ARG italic_q ( bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_Î² ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_p ( bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG ] ] + blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p ( bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ roman_log italic_p ( bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ] ] + blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p ( bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ roman_log divide start_ARG italic_p ( bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_Î² ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_q ( bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_Î² ) end_ARG ] ]
=Is(ğm;Î²)âˆ’H(ğm)âˆ’ğ”¼q[KL(q(ğm|Î²)|p(ğm|Î²))]\displaystyle=I_{s}({\bf e}_{m};\beta)-H({\bf e}_{m})-{\mathbb{E}}_{q}[KL(q({% \bf e}_{m}|\beta)|p({\bf e}_{m}|\beta))]= italic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; italic_Î² ) - italic_H ( bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_K italic_L ( italic_q ( bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_Î² ) | italic_p ( bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_Î² ) ) ]
â‰¤Isâ¢(ğm;Î²)âˆ’Hâ¢(ğm)âˆ’0=Râ¢Hâ¢S,absentsubscriptğ¼ğ‘ subscriptğğ‘šğ›½ğ»subscriptğğ‘š0ğ‘…ğ»ğ‘†\displaystyle\leq I_{s}({\bf e}_{m};\beta)-H({\bf e}_{m})-0=RHS,â‰¤ italic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; italic_Î² ) - italic_H ( bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - 0 = italic_R italic_H italic_S , (22)

which concludes the proof of Theorem 4.1.

Appendix I Theoretical Analysis on Continuous Word Counts

Before going to the claims and proofs, first we specify some basic problem settings and assumptions. Suppose there are K+1ğ¾1K+1italic_K + 1 topic groups, each of which is regarded to be sampled from a parameterized multivariate Gaussian distribution. In specific, the K+1ğ¾1K+1italic_K + 1 â€™th distribution of topic has a much larger covariance, and in the same time, closed to the center of embedding space. The prementioned properties can be measured by a series of inequalities:

The approximate marginal log-likelihood of word embeddings, i.e., the third term of the ELBO as mentioned in Eqn. 2 of the main paper, is:

â„’(tâ¢râ¢aâ¢iâ¢n)superscriptâ„’ğ‘¡ğ‘Ÿğ‘ğ‘–ğ‘›\displaystyle\mathcal{L}^{(train)}caligraphic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t italic_r italic_a italic_i italic_n ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT =âˆ‘j=1Jmğ”¼qâ¢[logâ¡pâ¢(ğmâ¢j|zmâ¢j,ğzmâ¢j,ğšºzmâ¢j)]absentsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘—1subscriptğ½ğ‘šsubscriptğ”¼ğ‘delimited-[]ğ‘conditionalsubscriptğğ‘šğ‘—subscriptğ‘§ğ‘šğ‘—subscriptğsubscriptğ‘§ğ‘šğ‘—subscriptğšºsubscriptğ‘§ğ‘šğ‘—\displaystyle=\sum\nolimits_{j=1}^{J_{m}}{\mathbb{E}}_{q}[\log p({\bf e}_{mj}|% z_{mj},\mbox{\boldmath$\mu$\unboldmath}_{z_{mj}},\mbox{\boldmath$\Sigma$% \unboldmath}_{z_{mj}})]= âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_J start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ roman_log italic_p ( bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_italic_Î¼ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_Î£ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ]
=âˆ‘m,j,kÏ•mâ¢jâ¢kâ¢wmâ¢jâ¢{âˆ’12â¢(ğmâ¢jâˆ’ğk)Tâ¢ğšºkâˆ’1â¢(ğmâ¢jâˆ’ğk)âˆ’logâ¡[(2â¢Ï€)d/2â¢|ğšºk|1/2]}.absentsubscriptğ‘šğ‘—ğ‘˜subscriptitalic-Ï•ğ‘šğ‘—ğ‘˜subscriptğ‘¤ğ‘šğ‘—12superscriptsubscriptğğ‘šğ‘—subscriptğğ‘˜ğ‘‡superscriptsubscriptğšºğ‘˜1subscriptğğ‘šğ‘—subscriptğğ‘˜superscript2ğœ‹ğ‘‘2superscriptsubscriptğšºğ‘˜12\displaystyle=\sum_{m,j,k}\phi_{mjk}w_{mj}\{-\tfrac{1}{2}({\bf e}_{mj}-\mbox{% \boldmath$\mu$\unboldmath}_{k})^{T}\mbox{\boldmath$\Sigma$\unboldmath}_{k}^{-1% }({\bf e}_{mj}-\mbox{\boldmath$\mu$\unboldmath}_{k})-\log[(2\pi)^{d/2}|\mbox{% \boldmath$\Sigma$\unboldmath}_{k}|^{1/2}]\}.= âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m , italic_j , italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï• start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_j italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT { - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG ( bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - bold_italic_Î¼ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT bold_Î£ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - bold_italic_Î¼ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - roman_log [ ( 2 italic_Ï€ ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d / 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | bold_Î£ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 / 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] } . (23)

The above equation is the training objective, yet for fair comparison of different training schemes, we calculate the approximated likelihood with word count 1111 for all words.

â„’(eâ¢vâ¢aâ¢l)superscriptâ„’ğ‘’ğ‘£ğ‘ğ‘™\displaystyle\mathcal{L}^{(eval)}caligraphic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_e italic_v italic_a italic_l ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT =âˆ‘j=1Jmğ”¼qâ¢[logâ¡pâ€²â¢(ğmâ¢j|zmâ¢j,ğzmâ¢j,ğšºzmâ¢j)]absentsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘—1subscriptğ½ğ‘šsubscriptğ”¼ğ‘delimited-[]superscriptğ‘â€²conditionalsubscriptğğ‘šğ‘—subscriptğ‘§ğ‘šğ‘—subscriptğsubscriptğ‘§ğ‘šğ‘—subscriptğšºsubscriptğ‘§ğ‘šğ‘—\displaystyle=\sum\nolimits_{j=1}^{J_{m}}{\mathbb{E}}_{q}[\log p^{\prime}({\bf e% }_{mj}|z_{mj},\mbox{\boldmath$\mu$\unboldmath}_{z_{mj}},\mbox{\boldmath$\Sigma% $\unboldmath}_{z_{mj}})]= âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_J start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ roman_log italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_italic_Î¼ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_Î£ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ]
=âˆ‘m,j,kÏ•mâ¢jâ¢kâ¢{âˆ’12â¢(ğmâ¢jâˆ’ğk)Tâ¢ğšºkâˆ’1â¢(ğmâ¢jâˆ’ğk)âˆ’logâ¡[(2â¢Ï€)d/2â¢|ğšºk|1/2]}.absentsubscriptğ‘šğ‘—ğ‘˜subscriptitalic-Ï•ğ‘šğ‘—ğ‘˜12superscriptsubscriptğğ‘šğ‘—subscriptğğ‘˜ğ‘‡superscriptsubscriptğšºğ‘˜1subscriptğğ‘šğ‘—subscriptğğ‘˜superscript2ğœ‹ğ‘‘2superscriptsubscriptğšºğ‘˜12\displaystyle=\sum_{m,j,k}\phi_{mjk}\{-\tfrac{1}{2}({\bf e}_{mj}-\mbox{% \boldmath$\mu$\unboldmath}_{k})^{T}\mbox{\boldmath$\Sigma$\unboldmath}_{k}^{-1% }({\bf e}_{mj}-\mbox{\boldmath$\mu$\unboldmath}_{k})-\log[(2\pi)^{d/2}|\mbox{% \boldmath$\Sigma$\unboldmath}_{k}|^{1/2}]\}.= âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m , italic_j , italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï• start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_j italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT { - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG ( bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - bold_italic_Î¼ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT bold_Î£ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - bold_italic_Î¼ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - roman_log [ ( 2 italic_Ï€ ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d / 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | bold_Î£ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 / 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] } . (24)

I.1 Gaussian Mixture Models

Suppose we have a ground truth GMM model with parameters ğ…âˆ—âˆˆâ„Ksuperscriptğ…superscriptâ„ğ¾\mbox{\boldmath$\pi$\unboldmath}^{*}\in\mathbb{R}^{K}bold_italic_Ï€ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆˆ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and {ğkâˆ—,ğšºkâˆ—}k=1Ksuperscriptsubscriptsuperscriptsubscriptğğ‘˜superscriptsubscriptğšºğ‘˜ğ‘˜1ğ¾\{\mbox{\boldmath$\mu$\unboldmath}_{k}^{*},\mbox{\boldmath$\Sigma$\unboldmath}% _{k}^{*}\}_{k=1}^{K}{ bold_italic_Î¼ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , bold_Î£ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT } start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, with Kğ¾Kitalic_K different Gaussian distributions. In the dataset, let Nğ‘Nitalic_N and Nssubscriptğ‘ğ‘ N_{s}italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT denote the numbers of non-stop-words and stop-words, respectively. Then the marginal log likelihood of a learned GMM model on a given data sample ğğ{\bf e}bold_e can be written as

pâ¢(ğ|{ğ,ğšº},ğ…)=âˆ‘k=1Kğ…kâ¢ğ’©â¢(ğ;ğk,ğšºk).ğ‘conditionalğğğšºğ…superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜1ğ¾subscriptğ…ğ‘˜ğ’©ğsubscriptğğ‘˜subscriptğšºğ‘˜\displaystyle p({\bf e}|\{\mbox{\boldmath$\mu$\unboldmath},\mbox{\boldmath$% \Sigma$\unboldmath}\},\mbox{\boldmath$\pi$\unboldmath})=\sum_{k=1}^{K}\mbox{% \boldmath$\pi$\unboldmath}_{k}\mathcal{N}({\bf e};\mbox{\boldmath$\mu$% \unboldmath}_{k},\mbox{\boldmath$\Sigma$\unboldmath}_{k}).italic_p ( bold_e | { bold_italic_Î¼ , bold_Î£ } , bold_italic_Ï€ ) = âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT bold_italic_Ï€ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_N ( bold_e ; bold_italic_Î¼ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_Î£ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) . (25)

Assuming a dataset of N+Nsğ‘subscriptğ‘ğ‘ N+N_{s}italic_N + italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT words {ği}i=1N+Nssuperscriptsubscriptsubscriptğğ‘–ğ‘–1ğ‘subscriptğ‘ğ‘ \{{\bf e}_{i}\}_{i=1}^{N+N_{s}}{ bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N + italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and taking the associated weights wisubscriptğ‘¤ğ‘–w_{i}italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT for each word into account, the log-likelihood of the dataset can be written as

âˆ‘i=1N+Nspâ¢(ği|{ğk,ğšºk}k=1K,ğ…)=âˆ‘i=1Nlogâ¢âˆ‘k=1Kwiâ¢ğ…kâ¢ğ’©â¢(ği;ğk,ğšºk)+âˆ‘i=N+1N+Nslogâ¢âˆ‘k=1Kwiâ¢ğ…kâ¢ğ’©â¢(ği;ğk,ğšºk).superscriptsubscriptğ‘–1ğ‘subscriptğ‘ğ‘ ğ‘conditionalsubscriptğğ‘–superscriptsubscriptsubscriptğğ‘˜subscriptğšºğ‘˜ğ‘˜1ğ¾ğ…superscriptsubscriptğ‘–1ğ‘superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜1ğ¾subscriptğ‘¤ğ‘–subscriptğ…ğ‘˜ğ’©subscriptğğ‘–subscriptğğ‘˜subscriptğšºğ‘˜superscriptsubscriptğ‘–ğ‘1ğ‘subscriptğ‘ğ‘ superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜1ğ¾subscriptğ‘¤ğ‘–subscriptğ…ğ‘˜ğ’©subscriptğğ‘–subscriptğğ‘˜subscriptğšºğ‘˜\displaystyle\sum_{i=1}^{N+N_{s}}p({\bf e}_{i}|\{\mbox{\boldmath$\mu$% \unboldmath}_{k},\mbox{\boldmath$\Sigma$\unboldmath}_{k}\}_{k=1}^{K},\mbox{% \boldmath$\pi$\unboldmath})=\sum_{i=1}^{N}\log\sum_{k=1}^{K}w_{i}\mbox{% \boldmath$\pi$\unboldmath}_{k}\mathcal{N}({\bf e}_{i};\mbox{\boldmath$\mu$% \unboldmath}_{k},\mbox{\boldmath$\Sigma$\unboldmath}_{k})+\sum_{i=N+1}^{N+N_{s% }}\log\sum_{k=1}^{K}w_{i}\mbox{\boldmath$\pi$\unboldmath}_{k}\mathcal{N}({\bf e% }_{i};\mbox{\boldmath$\mu$\unboldmath}_{k},\mbox{\boldmath$\Sigma$\unboldmath}% _{k}).âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N + italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_p ( bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | { bold_italic_Î¼ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_Î£ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , bold_italic_Ï€ ) = âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_log âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_Ï€ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_N ( bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_italic_Î¼ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_Î£ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = italic_N + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N + italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_log âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_Ï€ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_N ( bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_italic_Î¼ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_Î£ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) . (26)

Leveraging Jensenâ€™s inequality, we obtain a lower bound of the above quantity (denoting as ğš¯ğš¯\Thetabold_Î˜ the collection of parameters {ğk,ğšºk}k=1Ksuperscriptsubscriptsubscriptğğ‘˜subscriptğšºğ‘˜ğ‘˜1ğ¾\{\mbox{\boldmath$\mu$\unboldmath}_{k},\mbox{\boldmath$\Sigma$\unboldmath}_{k}% \}_{k=1}^{K}{ bold_italic_Î¼ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_Î£ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and ğ…ğ…\pibold_italic_Ï€):

â„’GMMâ¢(ğš¯,{wi})=âˆ‘i=1Nwiâ¢logâ¢âˆ‘k=1KÏ€kâ¢ğ’©â¢(ği;ğk,ğšºk)+âˆ‘i=N+1N+Nswiâ¢logâ¢âˆ‘k=1KÏ€kâ¢ğ’©â¢(ği;ğk,ğšºk)+C,subscriptâ„’GMMğš¯subscriptğ‘¤ğ‘–superscriptsubscriptğ‘–1ğ‘subscriptğ‘¤ğ‘–superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜1ğ¾subscriptğœ‹ğ‘˜ğ’©subscriptğğ‘–subscriptğğ‘˜subscriptğšºğ‘˜superscriptsubscriptğ‘–ğ‘1ğ‘subscriptğ‘ğ‘ subscriptğ‘¤ğ‘–superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜1ğ¾subscriptğœ‹ğ‘˜ğ’©subscriptğğ‘–subscriptğğ‘˜subscriptğšºğ‘˜ğ¶\displaystyle\mathcal{L}_{\text{GMM}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath},\{w_% {i}\})=\sum_{i=1}^{N}w_{i}\log\sum_{k=1}^{K}\pi_{k}\mathcal{N}({\bf e}_{i};% \mbox{\boldmath$\mu$\unboldmath}_{k},\mbox{\boldmath$\Sigma$\unboldmath}_{k})+% \sum_{i=N+1}^{N+N_{s}}w_{i}\log\sum_{k=1}^{K}\pi_{k}\mathcal{N}({\bf e}_{i};% \mbox{\boldmath$\mu$\unboldmath}_{k},\mbox{\boldmath$\Sigma$\unboldmath}_{k})+C,caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT GMM end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Î˜ , { italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } ) = âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_log âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Ï€ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_N ( bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_italic_Î¼ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_Î£ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = italic_N + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N + italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_log âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Ï€ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_N ( bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_italic_Î¼ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_Î£ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + italic_C , (27)

where C is a constant.

In the following theoretical analysis, we consider the following three different configurations of the weights wisubscriptğ‘¤ğ‘–w_{i}italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT.

Definition I.1 (Weight Configurations).

We define three different weight configurations as follows:

  • â€¢

    Identical Weights: wi=1N+Nssubscriptğ‘¤ğ‘–1ğ‘subscriptğ‘ğ‘ w_{i}=\tfrac{1}{N+N_{s}}italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N + italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG, iâˆˆ{1,2,â€¦,N+Ns}ğ‘–12â€¦ğ‘subscriptğ‘ğ‘ i\in\{1,2,\dots,N+N_{s}\}italic_i âˆˆ { 1 , 2 , â€¦ , italic_N + italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT }

  • â€¢

    Ground-Truth Weights : wi={1N,iâˆˆ{1,2,â€¦,N}0,iâˆˆ{N+1,N+2,â€¦,N+Ns}subscriptğ‘¤ğ‘–cases1ğ‘ğ‘–12â€¦ğ‘otherwise0ğ‘–ğ‘1ğ‘2â€¦ğ‘subscriptğ‘ğ‘ otherwisew_{i}=\begin{cases}\tfrac{1}{N},~{}~{}i\in\{1,2,\dots,N\}\\ 0,~{}~{}i\in\{N+1,N+2,\dots,N+N_{s}\}\end{cases}italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = { start_ROW start_CELL divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N end_ARG , italic_i âˆˆ { 1 , 2 , â€¦ , italic_N } end_CELL start_CELL end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL 0 , italic_i âˆˆ { italic_N + 1 , italic_N + 2 , â€¦ , italic_N + italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } end_CELL start_CELL end_CELL end_ROW

  • â€¢

    Attention-Based Weights: wi={Î»1âˆˆ[1N+Ns,1N],iâˆˆ{1,2,â€¦,N}Î»2âˆˆ[0,1N+Ns],iâˆˆ{N+1,N+2,â€¦,N+Ns}subscriptğ‘¤ğ‘–casesformulae-sequencesubscriptğœ†11ğ‘subscriptğ‘ğ‘ 1ğ‘ğ‘–12â€¦ğ‘otherwiseformulae-sequencesubscriptğœ†201ğ‘subscriptğ‘ğ‘ ğ‘–ğ‘1ğ‘2â€¦ğ‘subscriptğ‘ğ‘ otherwisew_{i}=\begin{cases}\lambda_{1}\in[\tfrac{1}{N+N_{s}},\tfrac{1}{N}],~{}~{}i\in% \{1,2,\dots,N\}\\ \lambda_{2}\in[0,\tfrac{1}{N+N_{s}}],~{}~{}i\in\{N+1,N+2,\dots,N+N_{s}\}\end{cases}italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = { start_ROW start_CELL italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆˆ [ divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N + italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG , divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N end_ARG ] , italic_i âˆˆ { 1 , 2 , â€¦ , italic_N } end_CELL start_CELL end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆˆ [ 0 , divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N + italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ] , italic_i âˆˆ { italic_N + 1 , italic_N + 2 , â€¦ , italic_N + italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } end_CELL start_CELL end_CELL end_ROW

Definition I.2 (Advanced Weight Configurations).

We define three different weight configurations as follows:

  • â€¢

    Identical Weights: wi=1N+Nssubscriptğ‘¤ğ‘–1ğ‘subscriptğ‘ğ‘ w_{i}=\tfrac{1}{N+N_{s}}italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N + italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG, iâˆˆ{1,2,â€¦,N+Ns}ğ‘–12â€¦ğ‘subscriptğ‘ğ‘ i\in\{1,2,\dots,N+N_{s}\}italic_i âˆˆ { 1 , 2 , â€¦ , italic_N + italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT }

  • â€¢

    Ground-Truth Weights : wi={1N,iâˆˆ{1,2,â€¦,N}0,iâˆˆ{N+1,N+2,â€¦,N+Ns}subscriptğ‘¤ğ‘–cases1ğ‘ğ‘–12â€¦ğ‘otherwise0ğ‘–ğ‘1ğ‘2â€¦ğ‘subscriptğ‘ğ‘ otherwisew_{i}=\begin{cases}\tfrac{1}{N},~{}~{}i\in\{1,2,\dots,N\}\\ 0,~{}~{}i\in\{N+1,N+2,\dots,N+N_{s}\}\end{cases}italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = { start_ROW start_CELL divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N end_ARG , italic_i âˆˆ { 1 , 2 , â€¦ , italic_N } end_CELL start_CELL end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL 0 , italic_i âˆˆ { italic_N + 1 , italic_N + 2 , â€¦ , italic_N + italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } end_CELL start_CELL end_CELL end_ROW

  • â€¢

    Attention-Based Weights: wiâˆˆ{[1N+Ns,1N],iâˆˆ{1,2,â€¦,N}[0,1N+Ns],iâˆˆ{N+1,N+2,â€¦,N+Ns}subscriptğ‘¤ğ‘–cases1ğ‘subscriptğ‘ğ‘ 1ğ‘ğ‘–12â€¦ğ‘otherwise01ğ‘subscriptğ‘ğ‘ ğ‘–ğ‘1ğ‘2â€¦ğ‘subscriptğ‘ğ‘ otherwisew_{i}\in\begin{cases}[\tfrac{1}{N+N_{s}},\tfrac{1}{N}],~{}~{}i\in\{1,2,\dots,N% \}\\ [0,\tfrac{1}{N+N_{s}}],~{}~{}i\in\{N+1,N+2,\dots,N+N_{s}\}\end{cases}italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆˆ { start_ROW start_CELL [ divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N + italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG , divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N end_ARG ] , italic_i âˆˆ { 1 , 2 , â€¦ , italic_N } end_CELL start_CELL end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL [ 0 , divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N + italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ] , italic_i âˆˆ { italic_N + 1 , italic_N + 2 , â€¦ , italic_N + italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } end_CELL start_CELL end_CELL end_ROW

Definition I.3 (Optimal Parameters).

WithÂ DefinitionÂ I.1, the corresponding optimal parameters are then defined as follows:

ğš¯I=argâ¡maxğš¯â¡â„’â¢(ğš¯;ğ°â†’Identical),subscriptğš¯ğ¼subscriptğš¯â„’â†’ğš¯ğ°Identical\displaystyle\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{I}=\arg\max_{\mbox{\boldmath% $\Theta$\unboldmath}}\mathcal{L}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath};{\bf w}% \rightarrow\mbox{Identical}),bold_Î˜ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_I end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = roman_arg roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_Î˜ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_L ( bold_Î˜ ; bold_w â†’ Identical ) , (28)
ğš¯G=argâ¡maxğš¯â¡â„’â¢(ğš¯;ğ°â†’GT),subscriptğš¯ğºsubscriptğš¯â„’â†’ğš¯ğ°GT\displaystyle\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{G}=\arg\max_{\mbox{\boldmath% $\Theta$\unboldmath}}\mathcal{L}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath};{\bf w}% \rightarrow\mbox{GT}),bold_Î˜ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = roman_arg roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_Î˜ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_L ( bold_Î˜ ; bold_w â†’ GT ) , (29)
ğš¯A=argâ¡maxğš¯â¡â„’â¢(ğš¯;ğ°â†’Attention),subscriptğš¯ğ´subscriptğš¯â„’â†’ğš¯ğ°Attention\displaystyle\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{A}=\arg\max_{\mbox{\boldmath% $\Theta$\unboldmath}}\mathcal{L}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath};{\bf w}% \rightarrow\mbox{Attention}),bold_Î˜ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = roman_arg roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_Î˜ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_L ( bold_Î˜ ; bold_w â†’ Attention ) , (30)

where ğ°â†’Identicalâ†’ğ°Identical{\bf w}\rightarrow\mbox{Identical}bold_w â†’ Identical, ğ°â†’GTâ†’ğ°GT{\bf w}\rightarrow\mbox{GT}bold_w â†’ GT, and ğ°â†’Attentionâ†’ğ°Attention{\bf w}\rightarrow\mbox{Attention}bold_w â†’ Attention indicates that â€˜Identical Weightsâ€™, â€˜Ground-Truth Weightsâ€™, and â€˜Attention-Based Weightsâ€™ are used, respectively.

Lemma I.1.

Suppose we have two series of functions {f1,iâ¢(x)}subscriptğ‘“1ğ‘–ğ‘¥\{f_{1,i}(x)\}{ italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ) } and {f2,iâ¢(x)}subscriptğ‘“2ğ‘–ğ‘¥\{f_{2,i}(x)\}{ italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ) }, with two non-negative weighting parameters Î»1,Î»2subscriptğœ†1subscriptğœ†2\lambda_{1},\lambda_{2}italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT satisfying Nâ¢Î»1+Nsâ¢Î»2=1ğ‘subscriptğœ†1subscriptğ‘ğ‘ subscriptğœ†21N\lambda_{1}+N_{s}\lambda_{2}=1italic_N italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 1. We define the final objective function fâ¢(â‹…)ğ‘“â‹…f(\cdot)italic_f ( â‹… ) as:

fâ¢(x;Î»1,Î»2)=Î»1â¢âˆ‘i=1Nf1,iâ¢(x)+Î»2â¢âˆ‘i=N+1Nsf2,iâ¢(x).ğ‘“ğ‘¥subscriptğœ†1subscriptğœ†2subscriptğœ†1superscriptsubscriptğ‘–1ğ‘subscriptğ‘“1ğ‘–ğ‘¥subscriptğœ†2superscriptsubscriptğ‘–ğ‘1subscriptğ‘ğ‘ subscriptğ‘“2ğ‘–ğ‘¥\displaystyle f(x;\lambda_{1},\lambda_{2})=\lambda_{1}\sum_{i=1}^{N}f_{1,i}(x)% +\lambda_{2}\sum_{i=N+1}^{N_{s}}f_{2,i}(x).italic_f ( italic_x ; italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ) + italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = italic_N + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ) . (31)

We assume two pairs of parameters (Î»1,Î»2)subscriptğœ†1subscriptğœ†2(\lambda_{1},\lambda_{2})( italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) and (Î»1â€²,Î»2â€²)subscriptsuperscriptğœ†â€²1subscriptsuperscriptğœ†â€²2(\lambda^{\prime}_{1},\lambda^{\prime}_{2})( italic_Î» start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_Î» start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ), where

Î»1â‰¥Î»1â€²,subscriptğœ†1subscriptsuperscriptğœ†â€²1\displaystyle\lambda_{1}\geq\lambda^{\prime}_{1},italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¥ italic_Î» start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , (32)
Î»2â‰¤Î»2â€².subscriptğœ†2subscriptsuperscriptğœ†â€²2\displaystyle\lambda_{2}\leq\lambda^{\prime}_{2}.italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¤ italic_Î» start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . (33)

Defining the optimal values of the objective function for different weighting parameters as

x^=argâ¡maxxâ¡fâ¢(x;Î»1,Î»2),^ğ‘¥subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘“ğ‘¥subscriptğœ†1subscriptğœ†2\displaystyle\widehat{x}=\arg\max_{x}f(x;\lambda_{1},\lambda_{2}),over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG = roman_arg roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f ( italic_x ; italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , (34)
x^â€²=argâ¡maxxâ¡fâ¢(x;Î»1â€²,Î»2â€²),superscript^ğ‘¥â€²subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘“ğ‘¥subscriptsuperscriptğœ†â€²1subscriptsuperscriptğœ†â€²2\displaystyle\widehat{x}^{\prime}=\arg\max_{x}f(x;\lambda^{\prime}_{1},\lambda% ^{\prime}_{2}),over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = roman_arg roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f ( italic_x ; italic_Î» start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_Î» start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , (35)

we then have that

fâ¢(x^;1N,0)â‰¥fâ¢(x^â€²;1N,0).ğ‘“^ğ‘¥1ğ‘0ğ‘“superscript^ğ‘¥â€²1ğ‘0\displaystyle f(\widehat{x};\tfrac{1}{N},0)\geq f(\widehat{x}^{\prime};\tfrac{% 1}{N},0).italic_f ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG ; divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N end_ARG , 0 ) â‰¥ italic_f ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ; divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N end_ARG , 0 ) . (36)
Proof.

We prove this theorem by contradiction. Suppose that we have

fâ¢(x^;1N,0)<fâ¢(x^â€²;1N,0).ğ‘“^ğ‘¥1ğ‘0ğ‘“superscript^ğ‘¥â€²1ğ‘0\displaystyle f(\widehat{x};\tfrac{1}{N},0)<f(\widehat{x}^{\prime};\tfrac{1}{N% },0).italic_f ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG ; divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N end_ARG , 0 ) < italic_f ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ; divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N end_ARG , 0 ) . (37)

According to Eq.Â 32, i.e., Î»1â‰¥Î»1â€²subscriptğœ†1subscriptsuperscriptğœ†â€²1\lambda_{1}\geq\lambda^{\prime}_{1}italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¥ italic_Î» start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, and the equation Nâ¢Î»1+Nsâ¢Î»2=1ğ‘subscriptğœ†1subscriptğ‘ğ‘ subscriptğœ†21N\lambda_{1}+N_{s}\lambda_{2}=1italic_N italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 1, we have

Î»1â¢Î»2â€²=Î»1â¢1âˆ’Nâ¢Î»1â€²Nsâ‰¥Î»1â€²â¢1âˆ’Nâ¢Î»1Ns=Î»1â€²â¢Î»2.subscriptğœ†1subscriptsuperscriptğœ†â€²2subscriptğœ†11ğ‘subscriptsuperscriptğœ†â€²1subscriptğ‘ğ‘ subscriptsuperscriptğœ†â€²11ğ‘subscriptğœ†1subscriptğ‘ğ‘ subscriptsuperscriptğœ†â€²1subscriptğœ†2\displaystyle\lambda_{1}\lambda^{\prime}_{2}=\lambda_{1}\tfrac{1-N\lambda^{% \prime}_{1}}{N_{s}}\geq\lambda^{\prime}_{1}\tfrac{1-N\lambda_{1}}{N_{s}}=% \lambda^{\prime}_{1}\lambda_{2}.italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT divide start_ARG 1 - italic_N italic_Î» start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG â‰¥ italic_Î» start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT divide start_ARG 1 - italic_N italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG = italic_Î» start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . (38)

According toÂ Eq.Â 35, we have the following equality:

fâ¢(x^;Î»1â€²,Î»2â€²)â‰¤fâ¢(x^â€²;Î»1â€²,Î»2â€²).ğ‘“^ğ‘¥subscriptsuperscriptğœ†â€²1subscriptsuperscriptğœ†â€²2ğ‘“superscript^ğ‘¥â€²subscriptsuperscriptğœ†â€²1subscriptsuperscriptğœ†â€²2\displaystyle f(\widehat{x};\lambda^{\prime}_{1},\lambda^{\prime}_{2})\leq f(% \widehat{x}^{\prime};\lambda^{\prime}_{1},\lambda^{\prime}_{2}).italic_f ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG ; italic_Î» start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_Î» start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) â‰¤ italic_f ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ; italic_Î» start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_Î» start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) . (39)

Combined with the aforementioned assumption inÂ Eq.Â 37, we have that

Î»2â€²â¢fâ¢(x^;Î»1,Î»2)=Î»1â¢Î»2â€²â¢âˆ‘i=1Nf1,iâ¢(x^)+Î»2â¢Î»2â€²â¢âˆ‘i=N+1Nsf2,iâ¢(x^)subscriptsuperscriptğœ†â€²2ğ‘“^ğ‘¥subscriptğœ†1subscriptğœ†2subscriptğœ†1subscriptsuperscriptğœ†â€²2superscriptsubscriptğ‘–1ğ‘subscriptğ‘“1ğ‘–^ğ‘¥subscriptğœ†2subscriptsuperscriptğœ†â€²2superscriptsubscriptğ‘–ğ‘1subscriptğ‘ğ‘ subscriptğ‘“2ğ‘–^ğ‘¥\displaystyle\lambda^{\prime}_{2}f(\widehat{x};\lambda_{1},\lambda_{2})=% \lambda_{1}\lambda^{\prime}_{2}\sum_{i=1}^{N}f_{1,i}(\widehat{x})+\lambda_{2}% \lambda^{\prime}_{2}\sum_{i=N+1}^{N_{s}}f_{2,i}(\widehat{x})italic_Î» start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG ; italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG ) + italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = italic_N + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG ) (40)
=\displaystyle== (Î»1â€²â¢Î»2â¢âˆ‘i=1Nf1,iâ¢(x^)+Î»2â€²â¢Î»2â¢âˆ‘i=N+1Nsf2,iâ¢(x^))+(Nâ¢(Î»1â¢Î»2â€²âˆ’Î»1â€²â¢Î»2)â‹…1Nâ¢âˆ‘i=1Nf1,iâ¢(x^))subscriptsuperscriptğœ†â€²1subscriptğœ†2superscriptsubscriptğ‘–1ğ‘subscriptğ‘“1ğ‘–^ğ‘¥subscriptsuperscriptğœ†â€²2subscriptğœ†2superscriptsubscriptğ‘–ğ‘1subscriptğ‘ğ‘ subscriptğ‘“2ğ‘–^ğ‘¥â‹…ğ‘subscriptğœ†1subscriptsuperscriptğœ†â€²2subscriptsuperscriptğœ†â€²1subscriptğœ†21ğ‘superscriptsubscriptğ‘–1ğ‘subscriptğ‘“1ğ‘–^ğ‘¥\displaystyle(\lambda^{\prime}_{1}\lambda_{2}\sum_{i=1}^{N}f_{1,i}(\widehat{x}% )+\lambda^{\prime}_{2}\lambda_{2}\sum_{i=N+1}^{N_{s}}f_{2,i}(\widehat{x}))+(N(% \lambda_{1}\lambda^{\prime}_{2}-\lambda^{\prime}_{1}\lambda_{2})\cdot\tfrac{1}% {N}\sum_{i=1}^{N}f_{1,i}(\widehat{x}))( italic_Î» start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG ) + italic_Î» start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = italic_N + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG ) ) + ( italic_N ( italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - =\displaystyle== Î»2â¢fâ¢(x^;Î»1â€²,Î»2â€²)+Nâ¢(Î»1â¢Î»2â€²âˆ’Î»1â€²â¢Î»2)â¢fâ¢(x^;1N,0)subscriptğœ†2ğ‘“^ğ‘¥subscriptsuperscriptğœ†â€²1subscriptsuperscriptğœ†â€²2ğ‘subscriptğœ†1subscriptsuperscriptğœ†â€²2subscriptsuperscriptğœ†â€²1subscriptğœ†2ğ‘“^ğ‘¥1ğ‘0\displaystyle{\lambda_{2}}f(\widehat{x};\lambda^{\prime}_{1},\lambda^{\prime}_% {2})+N(\lambda_{1}\lambda^{\prime}_{2}-\lambda^{\prime}_{1}\lambda_{2})f(% \widehat{x};\tfrac{1}{N},0)italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG ; italic_Î» start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_Î» start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + italic_N ( italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_Î» start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) italic_f ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG ; divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N end_ARG , 0 ) (42)
<\displaystyle<< Î»2â¢fâ¢(x^â€²;Î»1â€²,Î»2â€²)+Nâ¢(Î»1â¢Î»2â€²âˆ’Î»1â€²â¢Î»2)â¢fâ¢(x^â€²;1N,0)subscriptğœ†2ğ‘“superscript^ğ‘¥â€²subscriptsuperscriptğœ†â€²1subscriptsuperscriptğœ†â€²2ğ‘subscriptğœ†1subscriptsuperscriptğœ†â€²2subscriptsuperscriptğœ†â€²1subscriptğœ†2ğ‘“superscript^ğ‘¥â€²1ğ‘0\displaystyle{\lambda_{2}}f(\widehat{x}^{\prime};\lambda^{\prime}_{1},\lambda^% {\prime}_{2})+N(\lambda_{1}\lambda^{\prime}_{2}-{\lambda^{\prime}_{1}\lambda_{% 2}})f(\widehat{x}^{\prime};\tfrac{1}{N},0)italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ; italic_Î» start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_Î» start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + italic_N ( italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_Î» start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) italic_f ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ; divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N end_ARG , 0 ) (43)

=\displaystyle== Î»1â¢Î»2â€²â¢âˆ‘i=1Nf1,iâ¢(x^â€²)+Î»2â¢Î»2â€²â¢âˆ‘i=N+1Nsf2,iâ¢(x^â€²)subscriptğœ†1subscriptsuperscriptğœ†â€²2superscriptsubscriptğ‘–1ğ‘subscriptğ‘“1ğ‘–superscript^ğ‘¥â€²subscriptğœ†2subscriptsuperscriptğœ†â€²2superscriptsubscriptğ‘–ğ‘1subscriptğ‘ğ‘ subscriptğ‘“2ğ‘–superscript^ğ‘¥â€²\displaystyle\lambda_{1}\lambda^{\prime}_{2}\sum_{i=1}^{N}f_{1,i}(\widehat{x}^% {\prime})+\lambda_{2}\lambda^{\prime}_{2}\sum_{i=N+1}^{N_{s}}f_{2,i}(\widehat{% x}^{\prime})italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) + italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î» start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = italic_N + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) (45)
=\displaystyle== Î»2â€²â¢fâ¢(x^â€²;Î»1,Î»2),subscriptsuperscriptğœ†â€²2ğ‘“superscript^ğ‘¥â€²subscriptğœ†1subscriptğœ†2\displaystyle\lambda^{\prime}_{2}f(\widehat{x}^{\prime};\lambda_{1},\lambda_{2% }),italic_Î» start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ; italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , (46)

which contradicts the definition of x^^ğ‘¥\widehat{x}over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG inÂ Eq.Â 34 (i.e., x^^ğ‘¥\widehat{x}over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG maximizes fâ¢(x;Î»1,Î»2)ğ‘“ğ‘¥subscriptğœ†1subscriptğœ†2f(x;\lambda_{1},\lambda_{2})italic_f ( italic_x ; italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT )), completing the proof. âˆ

Lemma I.2.

Suppose we have two series of functions {f1,iâ¢(x)}subscriptğ‘“1ğ‘–ğ‘¥\{f_{1,i}(x)\}{ italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ) } and {f2,iâ¢(x)}subscriptğ‘“2ğ‘–ğ‘¥\{f_{2,i}(x)\}{ italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ) }, with two series of non-negative weighting parameters ğ›Œ1=[Î»1,i]i=1N,ğ›Œ2=[Î»2,i]i=N+1Nsformulae-sequencesubscriptğ›Œ1superscriptsubscriptdelimited-[]subscriptğœ†1ğ‘–ğ‘–1ğ‘subscriptğ›Œ2subscriptsuperscriptdelimited-[]subscriptğœ†2ğ‘–subscriptğ‘ğ‘ ğ‘–ğ‘1\mbox{\boldmath$\lambda$\unboldmath}_{1}=[\lambda_{1,i}]_{i=1}^{N},\mbox{% \boldmath$\lambda$\unboldmath}_{2}=[\lambda_{2,i}]^{N_{s}}_{i=N+1}bold_italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = [ italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , bold_italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = [ italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = italic_N + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT satisfying âˆ‘i=1NÎ»1,i+âˆ‘i=N+1NsÎ»2,i=1superscriptsubscriptğ‘–1ğ‘subscriptğœ†1ğ‘–superscriptsubscriptğ‘–ğ‘1subscriptğ‘ğ‘ subscriptğœ†2ğ‘–1\sum_{i=1}^{N}\lambda_{1,i}+\sum_{i=N+1}^{N_{s}}\lambda_{2,i}=1âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = italic_N + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 1. (47)

We assume two pairs of parameters (ğ›Œ1,ğ›Œ2)subscriptğ›Œ1subscriptğ›Œ2(\mbox{\boldmath$\lambda$\unboldmath}_{1},\mbox{\boldmath$\lambda$\unboldmath}% _{2})( bold_italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) and (ğ›Œ1â€²,ğ›Œ2â€²)subscriptsuperscriptğ›Œâ€²1subscriptsuperscriptğ›Œâ€²2(\mbox{\boldmath$\lambda$\unboldmath}^{\prime}_{1},\mbox{\boldmath$\lambda$% \unboldmath}^{\prime}_{2})( bold_italic_Î» start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_italic_Î» start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ), where

Î»1,iâ‰¥Î»1,iâ€²,iâˆˆ{1,2,â€¦,N},formulae-sequencesubscriptğœ†1ğ‘–subscriptsuperscriptğœ†â€²1ğ‘–ğ‘–12â€¦ğ‘\displaystyle\lambda_{1,i}\geq\lambda^{\prime}_{1,i},~{}~{}i\in\{1,2,...,N\},italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¥ italic_Î» start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_i âˆˆ { 1 , 2 , â€¦ , italic_N } , (48)
Î»2,iâ‰¤Î»2,iâ€²,iâˆˆ{N+1,N+2,â€¦,Ns}.formulae-sequencesubscriptğœ†2ğ‘–subscriptsuperscriptğœ†â€²2ğ‘–ğ‘–ğ‘1ğ‘2â€¦subscriptğ‘ğ‘ \displaystyle\lambda_{2,i}\leq\lambda^{\prime}_{2,i},~{}~{}i\in\{N+1,N+2,...,N% _{s}\}.italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¤ italic_Î» start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_i âˆˆ { italic_N + 1 , italic_N + 2 , â€¦ , italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } . (49)

Defining the optimal values of the objective function for different weighting parameters as

x^=argâ¡maxxâ¡fâ¢(x;ğ€1,ğ€2),^ğ‘¥subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘“ğ‘¥subscriptğ€1subscriptğ€2\displaystyle\widehat{x}=\arg\max_{x}f(x;\mbox{\boldmath$\lambda$\unboldmath}_% {1},\mbox{\boldmath$\lambda$\unboldmath}_{2}),over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG = roman_arg roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f ( italic_x ; bold_italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , (50)
x^â€²=argâ¡maxxâ¡fâ¢(x;ğ€1â€²,ğ€2â€²),superscript^ğ‘¥â€²subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘“ğ‘¥subscriptsuperscriptğ€â€²1subscriptsuperscriptğ€â€²2\displaystyle\widehat{x}^{\prime}=\arg\max_{x}f(x;\mbox{\boldmath$\lambda$% \unboldmath}^{\prime}_{1},\mbox{\boldmath$\lambda$\unboldmath}^{\prime}_{2}),over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = roman_arg roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f ( italic_x ; bold_italic_Î» start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_italic_Î» start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , (51)
xâˆ—=argâ¡maxâ¡fâ¢(x,ğŸN,ğŸ).superscriptğ‘¥ğ‘“ğ‘¥1ğ‘0\displaystyle x^{*}=\arg\max f(x,\tfrac{{\bf 1}}{N},{\bf 0}).italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = roman_arg roman_max italic_f ( italic_x , divide start_ARG bold_1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N end_ARG , bold_0 ) . (52)

Under the following Assumptions (with ğŸ1{\bf 1}bold_1 and ğŸ0{\bf 0}bold_0 denoting vectors with all entries equal to 1111 and 00, respectively):

  1. 1.

    fâ¢(x^,ğŸ,ğ€2)â‰¤fâ¢(x^â€²,ğŸ,ğ€2)ğ‘“^ğ‘¥0subscriptğ€2ğ‘“superscript^ğ‘¥â€²0subscriptğ€2f(\widehat{x},{\bf 0},\mbox{\boldmath$\lambda$\unboldmath}_{2})\leq f(\widehat% {x}^{\prime},{\bf 0},\mbox{\boldmath$\lambda$\unboldmath}_{2})italic_f ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG , bold_0 , bold_italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) â‰¤ italic_f ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , bold_0 , bold_italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ).

  2. 2.

    fâ¢(x;ğ€,ğŸ)â‰¥fâ¢(xâ€²;ğ€,ğŸ)ğ‘“ğ‘¥ğ€0ğ‘“superscriptğ‘¥â€²ğ€0f(x;\mbox{\boldmath$\lambda$\unboldmath},{\bf 0})\geq f(x^{\prime};\mbox{% \boldmath$\lambda$\unboldmath},{\bf 0})italic_f ( italic_x ; bold_italic_Î» , bold_0 ) â‰¥ italic_f ( italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ; bold_italic_Î» , bold_0 ), iff â€–xâˆ’xâˆ—â€–â‰¤â€–xâ€²âˆ’xâˆ—â€–,ğ€â‰¥0,â€–ğ€â€–1=1formulae-sequencenormğ‘¥superscriptğ‘¥normsuperscriptğ‘¥â€²superscriptğ‘¥formulae-sequenceğ€0subscriptnormğ€11\|x-x^{*}\|\leq\|x^{\prime}-x^{*}\|,~{}~{}\mbox{\boldmath$\lambda$\unboldmath}% \geq 0,~{}~{}\|\mbox{\boldmath$\lambda$\unboldmath}\|_{1}=1âˆ¥ italic_x - italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ¥ â‰¤ âˆ¥ italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ¥ , bold_italic_Î» â‰¥ 0 , âˆ¥ bold_italic_Î» âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 1.

we have that

fâ¢(x^;ğŸN,ğŸ)â‰¥fâ¢(x^â€²;ğŸN,ğŸ).ğ‘“^ğ‘¥1ğ‘0ğ‘“superscript^ğ‘¥â€²1ğ‘0\displaystyle f(\widehat{x};\tfrac{{\bf 1}}{N},{\bf 0})\geq f(\widehat{x}^{% \prime};\tfrac{{\bf 1}}{N},{\bf 0}).italic_f ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG ; divide start_ARG bold_1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N end_ARG , bold_0 ) â‰¥ italic_f ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ; divide start_ARG bold_1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N end_ARG , bold_0 ) . (53)
Proof.

We start with proving the following equality by contradiction:

â€–x^âˆ’xâˆ—â€–â‰¤â€–x^â€²âˆ’xâˆ—â€–.norm^ğ‘¥superscriptğ‘¥normsuperscript^ğ‘¥â€²superscriptğ‘¥\displaystyle\|\widehat{x}-x^{*}\|\leq\|\widehat{x}^{\prime}-x^{*}\|.âˆ¥ over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG - italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ¥ â‰¤ âˆ¥ over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ¥ . (54)

Specifically, if

â€–x^âˆ’xâˆ—â€–>â€–x^â€²âˆ’xâˆ—â€–,norm^ğ‘¥superscriptğ‘¥normsuperscript^ğ‘¥â€²superscriptğ‘¥\displaystyle\|\widehat{x}-x^{*}\|>\|\widehat{x}^{\prime}-x^{*}\|,âˆ¥ over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG - italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ¥ > âˆ¥ over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ¥ , (55)

leveraging the Assumption 1 and 2 above, we have that

fâ¢(x^;ğ€1,ğ€2)=fâ¢(x^;ğ€1,ğŸ)+fâ¢(x^;ğŸ,ğ€2)<fâ¢(x^â€²;ğ€1,ğŸ)+fâ¢(x^â€²;ğŸ,ğ€2)=fâ¢(x^â€²;ğ€1,ğ€2),ğ‘“^ğ‘¥subscriptğ€1subscriptğ€2ğ‘“^ğ‘¥subscriptğ€10ğ‘“^ğ‘¥0subscriptğ€2ğ‘“superscript^ğ‘¥â€²subscriptğ€10ğ‘“superscript^ğ‘¥â€²0subscriptğ€2ğ‘“superscript^ğ‘¥â€²subscriptğ€1subscriptğ€2\displaystyle f(\widehat{x};\mbox{\boldmath$\lambda$\unboldmath}_{1},\mbox{% \boldmath$\lambda$\unboldmath}_{2})=f(\widehat{x};\mbox{\boldmath$\lambda$% \unboldmath}_{1},{\bf 0})+f(\widehat{x};{\bf 0},\mbox{\boldmath$\lambda$% \unboldmath}_{2})<f(\widehat{x}^{\prime};\mbox{\boldmath$\lambda$\unboldmath}_% {1},{\bf 0})+f(\widehat{x}^{\prime};{\bf 0},\mbox{\boldmath$\lambda$% \unboldmath}_{2})=f(\widehat{x}^{\prime};\mbox{\boldmath$\lambda$\unboldmath}_% {1},\mbox{\boldmath$\lambda$\unboldmath}_{2}),italic_f ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG ; bold_italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = italic_f ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG ; bold_italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_0 ) + italic_f ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG ; bold_0 , bold_italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) < italic_f ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ; bold_italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_0 ) + italic_f ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ; bold_0 , bold_italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = italic_f ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ; bold_italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , (56)

which contradictsÂ Eq.Â 50. Therefore, Â Eq.Â 54 holds.

CombiningÂ Eq.Â 54 and Assumption 2 above, we have that

fâ¢(x^;ğŸN,ğŸ)â‰¥fâ¢(x^â€²;ğŸN,ğŸ),ğ‘“^ğ‘¥1ğ‘0ğ‘“superscript^ğ‘¥â€²1ğ‘0\displaystyle f(\widehat{x};\tfrac{{\bf 1}}{N},{\bf 0})\geq f(\widehat{x}^{% \prime};\tfrac{{\bf 1}}{N},{\bf 0}),italic_f ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG ; divide start_ARG bold_1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N end_ARG , bold_0 ) â‰¥ italic_f ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ; divide start_ARG bold_1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N end_ARG , bold_0 ) , (57)

concluding the proof. âˆ

Based on the definitions and lemmas above, we have the following theorems:

Theorem I.3 (Advantage of ğš¯Asubscriptğš¯ğ´\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{A}bold_Î˜ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT in the Simplified Case).

WithÂ DefinitionÂ I.1 andÂ DefinitionÂ I.3, comparing ğš¯Isubscriptğš¯ğ¼\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{I}bold_Î˜ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_I end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, ğš¯Gsubscriptğš¯ğº\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{G}bold_Î˜ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, and ğš¯Asubscriptğš¯ğ´\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{A}bold_Î˜ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT by evaluating them on the marginal log-likelihood of non-stop-words, i.e., â„’â¢(â‹…,wâ†’GT)â„’â†’â‹…ğ‘¤GT\mathcal{L}(\cdot,w\rightarrow\mbox{GT})caligraphic_L ( â‹… , italic_w â†’ GT ), we have that

â„’GMMâ¢(ğš¯I;ğ°â†’GT)â‰¤â„’GMMâ¢(ğš¯A;ğ°â†’GT)â‰¤â„’GMMâ¢(ğš¯G;ğ°â†’GT).subscriptâ„’GMMâ†’subscriptğš¯ğ¼ğ°GTsubscriptâ„’GMMâ†’subscriptğš¯ğ´ğ°GTsubscriptâ„’GMMâ†’subscriptğš¯ğºğ°GT\displaystyle\mathcal{L}_{\text{GMM}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{I};% {\bf w}\to\mbox{GT})\leq\mathcal{L}_{\text{GMM}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$% \unboldmath}_{A};{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT})\leq\mathcal{L}_{\text{GMM}}(\mbox{% \boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{G};{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT}).caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT GMM end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Î˜ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_I end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w â†’ GT ) â‰¤ caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT GMM end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Î˜ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w â†’ GT ) â‰¤ caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT GMM end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Î˜ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w â†’ GT ) . (58)
Proof.

First, by definition one can easily find that ğš¯Gsubscriptğš¯ğº\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{G}bold_Î˜ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT achieves the largest â„’â¢(â‹…;ğ°â†’GT)â„’â†’â‹…ğ°GT\mathcal{L}(\cdot;{\bf w}\rightarrow\mbox{GT})caligraphic_L ( â‹… ; bold_w â†’ GT ) among the three:

maxâ¡[â„’Gâ¢Mâ¢Mâ¢(ğš¯I;ğ°â†’GT),â„’Gâ¢Mâ¢Mâ¢(ğš¯A;ğ°â†’GT)]â‰¤maxğš¯â¡â„’Gâ¢Mâ¢Mâ¢(ğš¯;ğ°â†’GT)=â„’Gâ¢Mâ¢Mâ¢(ğš¯G;ğ°â†’GT).subscriptâ„’ğºğ‘€ğ‘€â†’subscriptğš¯ğ¼ğ°GTsubscriptâ„’ğºğ‘€ğ‘€â†’subscriptğš¯ğ´ğ°GTsubscriptğš¯subscriptâ„’ğºğ‘€ğ‘€â†’ğš¯ğ°GTsubscriptâ„’ğºğ‘€ğ‘€â†’subscriptğš¯ğºğ°GT\displaystyle\max[\mathcal{L}_{GMM}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{I};{% \bf w}\to\mbox{GT}),\mathcal{L}_{GMM}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{A};% {\bf w}\to\mbox{GT})]\leq\max_{\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}}\mathcal{L}% _{GMM}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath};{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT})=\mathcal{L}_{% GMM}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{G};{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT}).roman_max [ caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G italic_M italic_M end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Î˜ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_I end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w â†’ GT ) , caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G italic_M italic_M end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Î˜ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w â†’ GT ) ] â‰¤ roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_Î˜ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G italic_M italic_M end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Î˜ ; bold_w â†’ GT ) = caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G italic_M italic_M end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Î˜ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w â†’ GT ) . (59)

Next, we set {wi}i=1Nsuperscriptsubscriptsubscriptğ‘¤ğ‘–ğ‘–1ğ‘\{w_{i}\}_{i=1}^{N}{ italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT to Î»1subscriptğœ†1\lambda_{1}italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and {wi}i=N+1N+Nssuperscriptsubscriptsubscriptğ‘¤ğ‘–ğ‘–ğ‘1ğ‘subscriptğ‘ğ‘ \{w_{i}\}_{i=N+1}^{N+N_{s}}{ italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = italic_N + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N + italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT to Î»2subscriptğœ†2\lambda_{2}italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, respectively; ByÂ LemmaÂ I.1, we have that

â„’GMMâ¢(ğš¯A;ğ°â†’GT)â‰¤â„’GMMâ¢(ğš¯G;ğ°â†’GT).subscriptâ„’GMMâ†’subscriptğš¯ğ´ğ°GTsubscriptâ„’GMMâ†’subscriptğš¯ğºğ°GT\displaystyle\mathcal{L}_{\text{GMM}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{A};% {\bf w}\to\mbox{GT})\leq\mathcal{L}_{\text{GMM}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$% \unboldmath}_{G};{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT}).caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT GMM end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Î˜ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w â†’ GT ) â‰¤ caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT GMM end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Î˜ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w â†’ GT ) . (60)

Combining Eq.Â 59 and Eq.Â 60 concludes the proof. âˆ

TheoremÂ I.3 shows that under mild assumptions, the attention-based weights can help produce better estimates of ğš¯ğš¯\Thetabold_Î˜ in the presence of noisy stop-words and therefore learns higher-quality topics from the corpus, improving interpretability of FLMs.

Theorem I.4 (Advantage of ğš¯Asubscriptğš¯ğ´\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{A}bold_Î˜ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT in the General Case).

WithÂ DefinitionÂ I.2 andÂ DefinitionÂ I.3, comparing ğš¯Isubscriptğš¯ğ¼\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{I}bold_Î˜ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_I end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, ğš¯Gsubscriptğš¯ğº\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{G}bold_Î˜ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, and ğš¯Asubscriptğš¯ğ´\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{A}bold_Î˜ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT by evaluating them on the marginal log-likelihood of non-stop-words, i.e., â„’Gâ¢Mâ¢Mâ¢(â‹…,wâ†’GT)subscriptâ„’ğºğ‘€ğ‘€â†’â‹…ğ‘¤GT\mathcal{L}_{GMM}(\cdot,w\rightarrow\mbox{GT})caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G italic_M italic_M end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( â‹… , italic_w â†’ GT ), we have that

â„’GMMâ¢(ğš¯I;ğ°â†’GT)â‰¤â„’GMMâ¢(ğš¯A;ğ°â†’GT)â‰¤â„’GMMâ¢(ğš¯G;ğ°â†’GT).subscriptâ„’GMMâ†’subscriptğš¯ğ¼ğ°GTsubscriptâ„’GMMâ†’subscriptğš¯ğ´ğ°GTsubscriptâ„’GMMâ†’subscriptğš¯ğºğ°GT\displaystyle\mathcal{L}_{\text{GMM}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{I};% {\bf w}\to\mbox{GT})\leq\mathcal{L}_{\text{GMM}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$% \unboldmath}_{A};{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT})\leq\mathcal{L}_{\text{GMM}}(\mbox{% \boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{G};{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT}).caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT GMM end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Î˜ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_I end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w â†’ GT ) â‰¤ caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT GMM end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Î˜ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w â†’ GT ) â‰¤ caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT GMM end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Î˜ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w â†’ GT ) . (61)
Proof.

First, by definition one can easily find that ğš¯Gsubscriptğš¯ğº\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{G}bold_Î˜ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT achieves the largest â„’â¢(â‹…;ğ°â†’GT)â„’â†’â‹…ğ°GT\mathcal{L}(\cdot;{\bf w}\rightarrow\mbox{GT})caligraphic_L ( â‹… ; bold_w â†’ GT ) among the three:

maxâ¡[â„’GMMâ¢(ğš¯I;ğ°â†’GT),â„’GMMâ¢(ğš¯A;ğ°â†’GT)]â‰¤maxğš¯â¡â„’GMMâ¢(ğš¯;ğ°â†’GT)=â„’GMMâ¢(ğš¯G;ğ°â†’GT).subscriptâ„’GMMâ†’subscriptğš¯ğ¼ğ°GTsubscriptâ„’GMMâ†’subscriptğš¯ğ´ğ°GTsubscriptğš¯subscriptâ„’GMMâ†’ğš¯ğ°GTsubscriptâ„’GMMâ†’subscriptğš¯ğºğ°GT\displaystyle\max[\mathcal{L}_{\text{GMM}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}% _{I};{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT}),\mathcal{L}_{\text{GMM}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$% \unboldmath}_{A};{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT})]\leq\max_{\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$% \unboldmath}}\mathcal{L}_{\text{GMM}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath};{\bf w% }\to\mbox{GT})=\mathcal{L}_{\text{GMM}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{G% };{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT}).roman_max [ caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT GMM end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Î˜ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_I end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w â†’ GT ) , caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT GMM end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Î˜ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w â†’ GT ) ] â‰¤ roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_Î˜ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT GMM end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Î˜ ; bold_w â†’ GT ) = caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT GMM end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Î˜ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w â†’ GT ) . (62)

Next, we invokeÂ LemmaÂ I.2 by (1) setting {wi}i=1Nsuperscriptsubscriptsubscriptğ‘¤ğ‘–ğ‘–1ğ‘\{w_{i}\}_{i=1}^{N}{ italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT to ğ€1subscriptğ€1\mbox{\boldmath$\lambda$\unboldmath}_{1}bold_italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and {wi}i=N+1N+Nssuperscriptsubscriptsubscriptğ‘¤ğ‘–ğ‘–ğ‘1ğ‘subscriptğ‘ğ‘ \{w_{i}\}_{i=N+1}^{N+N_{s}}{ italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = italic_N + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N + italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT to ğ€2subscriptğ€2\mbox{\boldmath$\lambda$\unboldmath}_{2}bold_italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, respectively, and (2) rewriting logâ¢âˆ‘k=1KÏ€kâ¢ğ’©â¢(ği;ğk,ğšºk)superscriptsubscriptğ‘˜1ğ¾subscriptğœ‹ğ‘˜ğ’©subscriptğğ‘–subscriptğğ‘˜subscriptğšºğ‘˜\log\sum_{k=1}^{K}\pi_{k}\mathcal{N}({\bf e}_{i};\mbox{\boldmath$\mu$% \unboldmath}_{k},\mbox{\boldmath$\Sigma$\unboldmath}_{k})roman_log âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Ï€ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_N ( bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_italic_Î¼ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_Î£ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) as f1,iâ¢(x)subscriptğ‘“1ğ‘–ğ‘¥f_{1,i}(x)italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ) for iâˆˆ{1,2,â€¦,N}ğ‘–12â€¦ğ‘i\in\{1,2,\dots,N\}italic_i âˆˆ { 1 , 2 , â€¦ , italic_N } and f2,iâ¢(x)subscriptğ‘“2ğ‘–ğ‘¥f_{2,i}(x)italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ) for iâˆˆ{N+1,N+1,â€¦,N+Ns}ğ‘–ğ‘1ğ‘1â€¦ğ‘subscriptğ‘ğ‘ i\in\{N+1,N+1,\dots,N+N_{s}\}italic_i âˆˆ { italic_N + 1 , italic_N + 1 , â€¦ , italic_N + italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT }, where xğ‘¥xitalic_x corresponds to ğš¯â‰œ(ğ…,{ğk,ğšºk}k=1K)â‰œğš¯ğ…superscriptsubscriptsubscriptğğ‘˜subscriptğšºğ‘˜ğ‘˜1ğ¾\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}\triangleq(\mbox{\boldmath$\pi$\unboldmath}% ,\{\mbox{\boldmath$\mu$\unboldmath}_{k},\mbox{\boldmath$\Sigma$\unboldmath}_{k% }\}_{k=1}^{K})bold_Î˜ â‰œ ( bold_italic_Ï€ , { bold_italic_Î¼ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_Î£ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ). ByÂ LemmaÂ I.2, we then have that

â„’GMMâ¢(ğš¯A;ğ°â†’GT)â‰¤â„’GMMâ¢(ğš¯G;ğ°â†’GT).subscriptâ„’GMMâ†’subscriptğš¯ğ´ğ°GTsubscriptâ„’GMMâ†’subscriptğš¯ğºğ°GT\displaystyle\mathcal{L}_{\text{GMM}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{A};% {\bf w}\to\mbox{GT})\leq\mathcal{L}_{\text{GMM}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$% \unboldmath}_{G};{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT}).caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT GMM end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Î˜ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w â†’ GT ) â‰¤ caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT GMM end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Î˜ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w â†’ GT ) . (63)

Note that because f1,iâ¢(â‹…)subscriptğ‘“1ğ‘–â‹…f_{1,i}(\cdot)italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( â‹… ) and f2,iâ¢(â‹…)subscriptğ‘“2ğ‘–â‹…f_{2,i}(\cdot)italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 , italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( â‹… ) are Gaussian, therefore Assumption 1 and 2 inÂ LemmaÂ I.2 hold naturally under mild regularity conditions.

Combining Eq.Â 62 and Eq.Â 63 concludes the proof. âˆ

I.2 VALC as Interpreters

As mentioned inÂ Eq.Â B , the ELBO of the marginal likelihood (denoting as ğš¯ğš¯\Thetabold_Î˜ the collection of parameters Ï•,ğœ¸bold-italic-Ï•ğœ¸\mbox{\boldmath$\phi$\unboldmath},\mbox{\boldmath$\gamma$\unboldmath}bold_italic_Ï• , bold_italic_Î³ and {ğk,ğšºk}k=1Ksuperscriptsubscriptsubscriptğğ‘˜subscriptğšºğ‘˜ğ‘˜1ğ¾\{\mbox{\boldmath$\mu$\unboldmath}_{k},\mbox{\boldmath$\Sigma$\unboldmath}_{k}% \}_{k=1}^{K}{ bold_italic_Î¼ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_Î£ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT) is as follows:

â„’VALCâ¢(ğš¯;{wi})subscriptâ„’VALCğš¯subscriptğ‘¤ğ‘–\displaystyle\mathcal{L}_{\text{VALC}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath};\{w% _{i}\})caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT VALC end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Î˜ ; { italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } ) =âˆ‘j=1Lâ€²ğ”¼qâ¢[logâ¡pâ¢(ğmâ¢j|zmâ¢j,ğzmâ¢j,ğšºzmâ¢j)]absentsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘—1superscriptğ¿â€²subscriptğ”¼ğ‘delimited-[]ğ‘conditionalsubscriptğğ‘šğ‘—subscriptğ‘§ğ‘šğ‘—subscriptğsubscriptğ‘§ğ‘šğ‘—subscriptğšºsubscriptğ‘§ğ‘šğ‘—\displaystyle=\sum\nolimits_{j=1}^{L^{\prime}}{\mathbb{E}}_{q}[\log p({\bf e}_% {mj}|z_{mj},\mbox{\boldmath$\mu$\unboldmath}_{z_{mj}},\mbox{\boldmath$\Sigma$% \unboldmath}_{z_{mj}})]= âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ roman_log italic_p ( bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_italic_Î¼ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_Î£ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ]
=âˆ‘m,jwmâ¢jâ¢âˆ‘kÏ•mâ¢jâ¢kâ¢{âˆ’12â¢(ğmâ¢jâˆ’ğk)Tâ¢ğšºkâˆ’1â¢(ğmâ¢jâˆ’ğk)âˆ’logâ¡[(2â¢Ï€)H/2â¢|ğšºk|1/2]}.absentsubscriptğ‘šğ‘—subscriptğ‘¤ğ‘šğ‘—subscriptğ‘˜subscriptitalic-Ï•ğ‘šğ‘—ğ‘˜12superscriptsubscriptğğ‘šğ‘—subscriptğğ‘˜ğ‘‡superscriptsubscriptğšºğ‘˜1subscriptğğ‘šğ‘—subscriptğğ‘˜superscript2ğœ‹ğ»2superscriptsubscriptğšºğ‘˜12\displaystyle=\sum_{m,j}w_{mj}\sum_{k}\phi_{mjk}\{-\tfrac{1}{2}({\bf e}_{mj}-% \mbox{\boldmath$\mu$\unboldmath}_{k})^{T}\mbox{\boldmath$\Sigma$\unboldmath}_{% k}^{-1}({\bf e}_{mj}-\mbox{\boldmath$\mu$\unboldmath}_{k})-\log[(2\pi)^{H/2}|% \mbox{\boldmath$\Sigma$\unboldmath}_{k}|^{1/2}]\}.= âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m , italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï• start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_j italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT { - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG ( bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - bold_italic_Î¼ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT bold_Î£ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - bold_italic_Î¼ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - roman_log [ ( 2 italic_Ï€ ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_H / 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | bold_Î£ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 / 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] } . (64)

Based on the definitions and lemmas above, we have the following theorems:

Theorem I.5 (Advantage of ğš¯Asubscriptğš¯ğ´\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{A}bold_Î˜ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT in the Simplified Case).

WithÂ DefinitionÂ I.1 andÂ DefinitionÂ I.3, comparing ğš¯Isubscriptğš¯ğ¼\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{I}bold_Î˜ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_I end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, ğš¯Gsubscriptğš¯ğº\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{G}bold_Î˜ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, and ğš¯Asubscriptğš¯ğ´\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{A}bold_Î˜ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT by evaluating them on the marginal log-likelihood of non-stop-words, i.e., â„’â¢(â‹…,wâ†’GT)â„’â†’â‹…ğ‘¤GT\mathcal{L}(\cdot,w\rightarrow\mbox{GT})caligraphic_L ( â‹… , italic_w â†’ GT ), we have that

â„’VALCâ¢(ğš¯I;ğ°â†’GT)â‰¤â„’VALCâ¢(ğš¯A;ğ°â†’GT)â‰¤â„’VALCâ¢(ğš¯G;ğ°â†’GT).subscriptâ„’VALCâ†’subscriptğš¯ğ¼ğ°GTsubscriptâ„’VALCâ†’subscriptğš¯ğ´ğ°GTsubscriptâ„’VALCâ†’subscriptğš¯ğºğ°GT\displaystyle\mathcal{L}_{\text{VALC}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{I}% ;{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT})\leq\mathcal{L}_{\text{VALC}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$% \unboldmath}_{A};{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT})\leq\mathcal{L}_{\text{VALC}}(\mbox{% \boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{G};{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT}).caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT VALC end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Î˜ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_I end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w â†’ GT ) â‰¤ caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT VALC end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Î˜ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w â†’ GT ) â‰¤ caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT VALC end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Î˜ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w â†’ GT ) . (65)
Proof.

First, by definition one can easily find that ğš¯Gsubscriptğš¯ğº\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{G}bold_Î˜ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT achieves the largest â„’â¢(â‹…;ğ°â†’GT)â„’â†’â‹…ğ°GT\mathcal{L}(\cdot;{\bf w}\rightarrow\mbox{GT})caligraphic_L ( â‹… ; bold_w â†’ GT ) among the three:

maxâ¡[â„’VALCâ¢(ğš¯I;ğ°â†’GT),â„’VALCâ¢(ğš¯A;ğ°â†’GT)]â‰¤maxğš¯â¡â„’VALCâ¢(ğš¯;ğ°â†’GT)=â„’VALCâ¢(ğš¯G;ğ°â†’GT).subscriptâ„’VALCâ†’subscriptğš¯ğ¼ğ°GTsubscriptâ„’VALCâ†’subscriptğš¯ğ´ğ°GTsubscriptğš¯subscriptâ„’VALCâ†’ğš¯ğ°GTsubscriptâ„’VALCâ†’subscriptğš¯ğºğ°GT\displaystyle\max[\mathcal{L}_{\text{VALC}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath% }_{I};{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT}),\mathcal{L}_{\text{VALC}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$% \unboldmath}_{A};{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT})]\leq\max_{\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$% \unboldmath}}\mathcal{L}_{\text{VALC}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath};{% \bf w}\to\mbox{GT})=\mathcal{L}_{\text{VALC}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$% \unboldmath}_{G};{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT}).roman_max [ caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT VALC end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Î˜ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_I end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w â†’ GT ) , caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT VALC end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Î˜ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w â†’ GT ) ] â‰¤ roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_Î˜ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT VALC end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Î˜ ; bold_w â†’ GT ) = caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT VALC end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Î˜ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w â†’ GT ) . (66)

Next, we set âˆªm{wmâ¢j}j=1Nmsubscriptğ‘šsuperscriptsubscriptsubscriptğ‘¤ğ‘šğ‘—ğ‘—1subscriptğ‘ğ‘š\cup_{m}\{w_{mj}\}_{j=1}^{N_{m}}âˆª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT { italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT to Î»1subscriptğœ†1\lambda_{1}italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and âˆªm{wmâ¢j}j=Nm+1Nm+Nm,ssubscriptğ‘šsuperscriptsubscriptsubscriptğ‘¤ğ‘šğ‘—ğ‘—subscriptğ‘ğ‘š1subscriptğ‘ğ‘šsubscriptğ‘ğ‘šğ‘ \cup_{m}\{w_{mj}\}_{j=N_{m}+1}^{N_{m}+N_{m,s}}âˆª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT { italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j = italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m , italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT to Î»2subscriptğœ†2\lambda_{2}italic_Î» start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, respectively; we rewrite âˆ‘iÏ•mâ¢jâ¢iâ¢{âˆ’12â¢(ğmâ¢jâˆ’ği)Tâ¢ğšºiâˆ’1â¢(ğmâ¢jâˆ’ği)âˆ’logâ¡[(2â¢Ï€)d/2â¢|ğšºi|1/2]}subscriptğ‘–subscriptitalic-Ï•ğ‘šğ‘—ğ‘–12superscriptsubscriptğğ‘šğ‘—subscriptğğ‘–ğ‘‡superscriptsubscriptğšºğ‘–1subscriptğğ‘šğ‘—subscriptğğ‘–superscript2ğœ‹ğ‘‘2superscriptsubscriptğšºğ‘–12\sum_{i}\phi_{mji}\{-\tfrac{1}{2}({\bf e}_{mj}-\mbox{\boldmath$\mu$\unboldmath% }_{i})^{T}\mbox{\boldmath$\Sigma$\unboldmath}_{i}^{-1}({\bf e}_{mj}-\mbox{% \boldmath$\mu$\unboldmath}_{i})-\log[(2\pi)^{d/2}|\mbox{\boldmath$\Sigma$% \unboldmath}_{i}|^{1/2}]\}âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï• start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_j italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT { - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG ( bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - bold_italic_Î¼ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT bold_Î£ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_e start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - bold_italic_Î¼ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - roman_log [ ( 2 italic_Ï€ ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d / 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | bold_Î£ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 / 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] } as f1,jâ¢(x)subscriptğ‘“1ğ‘—ğ‘¥f_{1,j}(x)italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 , italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ) for jâˆˆâˆªm{1,2,â€¦,Nm}ğ‘—subscriptğ‘š12â€¦subscriptğ‘ğ‘šj\in\cup_{m}\{1,2,\dots,N_{m}\}italic_j âˆˆ âˆª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT { 1 , 2 , â€¦ , italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } and f2,jâ¢(x)subscriptğ‘“2ğ‘—ğ‘¥f_{2,j}(x)italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 , italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x ) for jâˆˆâˆªm{Nm+1,Nm+1,â€¦,Nm+Nm,s}ğ‘—subscriptğ‘šsubscriptğ‘ğ‘š1subscriptğ‘ğ‘š1â€¦subscriptğ‘ğ‘šsubscriptğ‘ğ‘šğ‘ j\in\cup_{m}\{N_{m}+1,N_{m}+1,\dots,N_{m}+N_{m,s}\}italic_j âˆˆ âˆª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT { italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 1 , italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 1 , â€¦ , italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m , italic_s end_POSTSUBSCRIPT }, where xğ‘¥xitalic_x corresponds to ğš¯â‰œ(Ï•,ğœ¸,{ğk,ğšºk}k=1K)â‰œğš¯bold-italic-Ï•ğœ¸superscriptsubscriptsubscriptğğ‘˜subscriptğšºğ‘˜ğ‘˜1ğ¾\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}\triangleq(\mbox{\boldmath$\phi$\unboldmath% },\mbox{\boldmath$\gamma$\unboldmath},\{\mbox{\boldmath$\mu$\unboldmath}_{k},% \mbox{\boldmath$\Sigma$\unboldmath}_{k}\}_{k=1}^{K})bold_Î˜ â‰œ ( bold_italic_Ï• , bold_italic_Î³ , { bold_italic_Î¼ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_Î£ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ). ByÂ LemmaÂ I.1, we have that

â„’VALCâ¢(ğš¯A;ğ°â†’GT)â‰¤â„’VALCâ¢(ğš¯G;ğ°â†’GT).subscriptâ„’VALCâ†’subscriptğš¯ğ´ğ°GTsubscriptâ„’VALCâ†’subscriptğš¯ğºğ°GT\displaystyle\mathcal{L}_{\text{VALC}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{A}% ;{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT})\leq\mathcal{L}_{\text{VALC}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$% \unboldmath}_{G};{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT}).caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT VALC end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Î˜ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w â†’ GT ) â‰¤ caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT VALC end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Î˜ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w â†’ GT ) . (67)

Combining Eq.Â 66 and Eq.Â 67 concludes the proof. âˆ

TheoremÂ I.5 shows that under mild assumptions, the attention-based weights can help produce better estimates of ğš¯ğš¯\Thetabold_Î˜ in the presence of noisy stop-words and therefore learns higher-quality topics from the corpus, improving and interpretability of FLMs.

Theorem I.6 (Advantage of ğš¯Asubscriptğš¯ğ´\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{A}bold_Î˜ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT in the General Case).

WithÂ DefinitionÂ I.2 andÂ DefinitionÂ I.3, comparing ğš¯Isubscriptğš¯ğ¼\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{I}bold_Î˜ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_I end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, ğš¯Gsubscriptğš¯ğº\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{G}bold_Î˜ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, and ğš¯Asubscriptğš¯ğ´\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{A}bold_Î˜ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT by evaluating them on the marginal log-likelihood of non-stop-words, i.e., â„’Vâ¢Aâ¢Lâ¢Câ¢(â‹…,wâ†’GT)subscriptâ„’ğ‘‰ğ´ğ¿ğ¶â†’â‹…ğ‘¤GT\mathcal{L}_{VALC}(\cdot,w\rightarrow\mbox{GT})caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_V italic_A italic_L italic_C end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( â‹… , italic_w â†’ GT ), we have that

â„’VALCâ¢(ğš¯I;ğ°â†’GT)â‰¤â„’VALCâ¢(ğš¯A;ğ°â†’GT)â‰¤â„’VALCâ¢(ğš¯G;ğ°â†’GT).subscriptâ„’VALCâ†’subscriptğš¯ğ¼ğ°GTsubscriptâ„’VALCâ†’subscriptğš¯ğ´ğ°GTsubscriptâ„’VALCâ†’subscriptğš¯ğºğ°GT\displaystyle\mathcal{L}_{\text{VALC}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{I}% ;{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT})\leq\mathcal{L}_{\text{VALC}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$% \unboldmath}_{A};{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT})\leq\mathcal{L}_{\text{VALC}}(\mbox{% \boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{G};{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT}).caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT VALC end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Î˜ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_I end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w â†’ GT ) â‰¤ caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT VALC end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Î˜ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w â†’ GT ) â‰¤ caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT VALC end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Î˜ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w â†’ GT ) . (68)
Proof.

First, by definition one can easily find that ğš¯Gsubscriptğš¯ğº\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{G}bold_Î˜ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT achieves the largest â„’â¢(â‹…;ğ°â†’GT)â„’â†’â‹…ğ°GT\mathcal{L}(\cdot;{\bf w}\rightarrow\mbox{GT})caligraphic_L ( â‹… ; bold_w â†’ GT ) among the three:

maxâ¡[â„’VALCâ¢(ğš¯I;ğ°â†’GT),â„’VALCâ¢(ğš¯A;ğ°â†’GT)]â‰¤maxğš¯â¡â„’VALCâ¢(ğš¯;ğ°â†’GT)=â„’VALCâ¢(ğš¯G;ğ°â†’GT).subscriptâ„’VALCâ†’subscriptğš¯ğ¼ğ°GTsubscriptâ„’VALCâ†’subscriptğš¯ğ´ğ°GTsubscriptğš¯subscriptâ„’VALCâ†’ğš¯ğ°GTsubscriptâ„’VALCâ†’subscriptğš¯ğºğ°GT\displaystyle\max[\mathcal{L}_{\text{VALC}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath% }_{I};{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT}),\mathcal{L}_{\text{VALC}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$% \unboldmath}_{A};{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT})]\leq\max_{\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$% \unboldmath}}\mathcal{L}_{\text{VALC}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath};{% \bf w}\to\mbox{GT})=\mathcal{L}_{\text{VALC}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$% \unboldmath}_{G};{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT}).roman_max [ caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT VALC end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Î˜ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_I end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w â†’ GT ) , caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT VALC end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Î˜ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w â†’ GT ) ] â‰¤ roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_Î˜ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT VALC end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Î˜ ; bold_w â†’ GT ) = caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT VALC end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Î˜ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w â†’ GT ) . (69)

ByÂ LemmaÂ I.2, we then have that

â„’VALCâ¢(ğš¯A;ğ°â†’GT)â‰¤â„’VALCâ¢(ğš¯G;ğ°â†’GT).subscriptâ„’VALCâ†’subscriptğš¯ğ´ğ°GTsubscriptâ„’VALCâ†’subscriptğš¯ğºğ°GT\displaystyle\mathcal{L}_{\text{VALC}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$\unboldmath}_{A}% ;{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT})\leq\mathcal{L}_{\text{VALC}}(\mbox{\boldmath$\Theta$% \unboldmath}_{G};{\bf w}\to\mbox{GT}).caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT VALC end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Î˜ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_A end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w â†’ GT ) â‰¤ caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT VALC end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_Î˜ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_w â†’ GT ) . (70)

Note that because f1,jâ¢(â‹…)subscriptğ‘“1ğ‘—â‹…f_{1,j}(\cdot)italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 , italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( â‹… ) and f2,jâ¢(â‹…)subscriptğ‘“2ğ‘—â‹…f_{2,j}(\cdot)italic_f start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 , italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( â‹… ) are very close to Gaussian, therefore Assumption 1 and 2 inÂ LemmaÂ I.2 hold naturally under mild regularity conditions.

Combining Eq.Â 69 and Eq.Â 70 concludes the proof. âˆ
